reviews.review: it is a part of my life.
Best Coop Shooter I played by far!

Get in a campaign
Get mad over characters
Start a hard campaign
Fight over difficulty
Shoot zombies in expert
Shoot teammates in expert
Kill each other at the start of each level
Finish campaign...WITH 1 PERSON ALIVE
A good zombie coop fps game.

An amazing co-op experience that never gets old, with lots of replayability and a good community with lots of mods, if you like zombies or playing with friends, this is a game you must buy! Even if you get tired of the old maps, there's plenty of downloadable ones, plus servers that offer more variety!
I played this on console for countless hours, so I decided to get this on steam. Needless to say it's just as good and since it's a PC game it has better graphics.

This game is extremely awesome in versus mode. Unfortunately to date the community is a complete tard pool of only a few active individuals.

Still far beter than l4d2 for a good vs among friends.

Co-op, Zombies and a lot of "Pew-Pew" action. No need to say more.
My first love and the reason I made a Steam account!

L4D will always be my most beloved game, ever.
It brings the fear, the fun, the teamplay you ever wished through several campaigns surviving hordes across a city from a SafeHouse to another. 

Medkits, ammo and good accuracy is all you need to survive.

The game offers a campaign co-op mode and also a Versus Mode.

The campaign is never boring thanks to the Director behind L4D spawning hordes and Tank ambushes randomly every time you simply dont know what to expect. The best Co-Op experience i've ever had.

The versus mode is also amazing. It places players on both sides, Survivors and Zombies.
The same maps but this time survivors facing real zombie players on the other side preventing your success.
4 survivors vs 4 special zombie units such as Hunters, Boomers, Tanks, Smokers each with a certain ability to stop the survivors progress. I spent many and many nights challenging other groups on tournaments.

My fav. game ever you cannot miss !

Left 4 Dead is a zombie-themed cooperative (or competive) team FPS made by Valve and Turtle Rock Studios, released in 2008 for PC. You play as one of the four survivors who have to get from point A to point B, while defending themselves from hordes of 'fast' zombies and search corners for supplies. Or you can play as special infected too, in more competive mode. Don't mind "Game of the Year Edition" over the banner, it's just there for coolness, not some complete edition. It did have three "free DLC" / big updates that added survival mode, Crash Cource and Sacrifice campaign since it came out.

Multiplayer community is still quiet alive, even though most moved over to Left 4 Dead 2. You will not always find exactly what you want, but you will still find some people playing the game. Aside from Survival mode, that part is empty, everybody was overrun by zombies it seems.

And well, it's a pretty great game. It got great setting, with a great atmosphere of always being set at night. With four likable characters. Simple yet deep gameplay. It is simple compared to L4D2, you don't have much choice, variations, in weapons for example. Feels more refined too. Somehow I dig it more. It even has two grenade types, which are actually useful and tactical in this horde based game.

The best thing about it is AI Director. In other words, it's a system that keeps track of players "stress level" and then would change position of items, zombies and other small changes. It's quiet clever in that it both serves as randomizer and also follows general rules of pacing. No, it's quite predictable. Moment of rushing zombies and wandering zombies change around, when it gets quiet that it means that something heavy is coming or that you barely survived previous challenge. And that it doesn't spawn zombies so good, so in Versus modes people just rush forward.
And while it's predictable, the different pacing still makes it much more addictive. The question is not what, but how soon and when.

But there is one thing which would make it hard to decide if to recommend it or not. All the campaigns ended up being included in L4D2! Not only that, but they were expanded with all the new stuff that L4D2 added. Weapons, special infected types. Not only that, but if you want more original experience, then you can run the mutator that limits content back to L4D1. Though it's a bit uneven. But still.
The only different things would be nitpick, like some slight level alternation, or not being able to see your body when moving camera down, or if you hate watching flying gibs from explosion for some reason.

And well, most people should just purchase L4D2 instead, as it has all that L4D1 got. The first one still has it's own appeal, to be honest, in small changes. Very small differences. But eh, leave it to purists of sorts. Otherwise, if you are core gamer of sorts, then buy it, It's awesome game by itself.

After ~20h:
PROS
+ nice Survivors, Infected, weapons, AI in solo-campaign
+ easy, simple and totally fun multi
+ Versus multi mode <3
+ ALL?

CONS
- sometimes the current campaign will work a lot harder than the previous
- some (and sometimes quite a lot of) people in a multi... drama. Not because they are playing badly, but because they consider themselves to be the best and vote for kickng again and again :/

Forever a must play...

(All my own opinions/experiences/joys)

As an avid fan of zombie games, I can honestly say this is the one I have enjoyed the most!

Once you've got your sensitivity set, you're set to take on the hordes of seemingly endless zombies, alongside your three friends (don't take it personally when they shoot you in the back, they're probably just trying to shoot the zombie that's about to swipe at you). I highly recommend getting up to three other people on board that you can speak to via headset. I say this due to the fact (and you may be surprised how often this occurs) they may not realise that you've been pounced on by a hunter, pulled away by a smoker or thrown up on by a boomer (...thus resulting in being molested by a horde of horny zombies, that want to rip your clothes off) and you will end up typing things like “jyghk!!!11!” in the chat, just to be abandoned, angry, on the ground, bleeding out, shooting wildly into the crowd of gropers around you.

So in short, get a headset... (And some friends)

After getting into the swing of sticking together and (although you may hate it) helping out your teammates, picking them up when they go down and parting with your precious pills to prolong their lives, you will  become a pro. You'll be running the Expert level campaigns, crowning witches, burning tanks, sniping hunters in the face mid jump, generally winning at the game.

Versus is another story... A lot of fun, however it's hard to find a normal server these days, so you'll be thrown into a 20 vs 20 game which is both hilariously fun and rage quittingly frustrating. So again, private games with friends trumps crazy hacker filled custom servers.

From playing Left 4 Dead for nights on end on the Xbox 360 with my buddy (MrSneakyMan), listening to Rammstein in order to pump ourselves up to fight the horde, to finally downloading it on PC and pouring even more hours into it. I still keep coming back to this game, sometimes for a quick versus match, other times to replay entire campaigns with the strangers of the internet (yeah, you...).

Just buy it... :)

当初买这个游戏，是和求生之路2打包折扣买的。说实话，2比1好了很多，但是我还是硬着头皮把战役通关了。

画质在08年算是比较好的，环境渲染的比较好，在我玩过的丧尸游戏里求生僵尸的设定是最不科学的，跑的比正常人都快！（悄悄说一句，我一个人玩单人的时候都有点瘆的慌）。所以我把战役打完后再也不想打第二次一个人的战役。（是我太胆小了？）

况且！这个游戏本来就不应该是一个人的游戏（我没找理由），但由于有了第2部的诞生，导致前作的多人模式根本没人玩。所以，除了这个方面外，除非你是想怀着怀旧的心情来买个情怀，没有打折千万不要买。

那么，为啥我给好评，因为这是种情怀（因为当初买它的时候它是打折的）！

[h1]L4D2 is better[/h1]

I'm gonna get really downvoted here but: 

- It's not because it is the second game, but I feel that L4D2's optimization is a lot better. I actually have more FPS drop in a L4D horde (falls from 60 fps to 40 while in L4D2 it falls from 60 to 55) and then you have the lack of modes and variety. 

= NOW ABOUT L4D ONLY = 

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]Creates a perfect apocalyptic environment
    [*]Co-Op is always good, specially for it's time
    [*]Fast-Paced
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
    [*]I don't really have anything I dislike here besides what has been said before. But If you play from L4D - L4D2 you will have a better experience than me, I shouldn't have played L4D2 first.
[/list]
